rounds.question: How many children did the fifth most fertile woman have in her lifetime?
rounds.answer: Maddalena Granata - Maddalena Granata (born 1839) Nocera, Italy, who married at 28, had given birth to 52 living and dead children, 49 being males, by 1886. Dr. de Sanctis, of Nocera, stated that she had 15 sets of triplets.

rounds.answer: Tastebuds for salt develops at around 4-6 months of age.

rounds.question: On a baby, where would you find the fontanelles?
rounds.answer: Fontanelles allow skull to compress during birth so it can pass through the birth canal.

rounds.question: The tar-like, sticky black poo that newborns initially poop, is called ....._

rounds.answer: Journal of Child Language in 2009, Jennifer Zapf and Linda Smith,

rounds.question: “Raising kids is part joy and part ......” — Ed Asner
rounds.answer: Says the internet. Also look up Ed Asner, because I don't know who he is.

rounds.question: “Having a new baby is like suddenly getting the world’s worst ......” — Anne Lamott
“Becoming a mom to me means that you have accepted that for the next 16 years of your life, you will have a sticky ......” - Nia Vardalos
“A two-year old is kind of like having a ....., but you don't have a top for it.” - Jerry Seinfeld
“When I tell my kids I'll do something in a minute, what I'm really saying is 'Please ......'” - @SarcasticMommy4
Name this toy - Toy that you place in your baby's bathwater to determine whether it is too hot, presumably because you do not have the hands capable of fulfilling this function.
Name this - Plastic giraffes, that are french and thus chic. It was mandatory to own atleast 3. Each costs $28.
Name this - Very uncool wheely-thing that allows you to transfer your baby from the car wherever you're going without waking him up, and is therefore the best.
Name this - A cloth bracelet, intended to be used as a tissue, when you don't have a tissue with you. As a bonus, it allows you to wear your child's boogers with pride.
Name this - Ergonomically designed resting area for a nursing baby, aka a pillow. Costs extra because its round.
Name this - Baby cage, that requires three fully-grown adults and six trips to the computer to figure out how to assemble.
Name this - Sling that you can hang on the door of a public bathroom, so that your baby has somewhere to chill, while you pee.
Name this - Anatomically correct stuffed woman with removable baby and detachable placenta used to visually communicate to small children EXACTLY how the miracle of childbirth works.
Name this - Banana flavored air crackers that you will find crumbs of around your home for the rest of your life.
